channel.title: Fixing broken cache?
channel.description: Can I do it? I have a cache editor, I'm just not really sure on what to do. Some of my NPC's are messed up, and I want to fix them. (i.e Chicken is Armydal Godsword special). So any help would be appreciated.

item.title: Fixing broken cache?
item.dc:creator: @Reisyukaku Reisyukaku
item.description:
@Reisyukaku wrote:

Where can i download new CLEAN cache for the galkon base client, and will replacing the cache permanently get rid of the problem?

Read full topic

item.title: Fixing broken cache?
item.description:
@14-08 wrote:

[quote=“Setsuna, post:8, topic:289778”][quote author=14-08 link=topic=383055.msg2876468#msg2876468 date=1248071143]
Sometimes, like with my own cache, it is broken and is simply fixable with a new cache.

But, like you already said, new caches don’t work with certain client.

So, my only recommendation would be to get a new client. Or, perhaps, look for a another downloadable cache. One is bound to work with your client.

 -- 14-08

[/quote]

Already stated.[/quote]

Not all of it…

Read full topic

item.title: Fixing broken cache?
item.dc:creator: @Setsuna Setsuna
item.description:
@Setsuna wrote:

[quote=“dillingo, post:9, topic:289778”][quote author=Tonic link=topic=383055.msg2876469#msg2876469 date=1248071419]

Sometimes, like with my own cache, it is broken and is simply fixable with a new cache.

But, like you already said, new caches don’t work with certain client.

So, my only recommendation would be to get a new client. Or, perhaps, look for a another downloadable cache. One is bound to work with your client.

 -- 14-08

If the items get messed up then just re add the models
[/quote]
Yeah I’ve been trying that too. It doesn’t work though. Besides, the cache I have now is the best compared to all the other client’s caches. Other clients really don’t work with my server either. Some, (Like Bluur’s) just disconnect you immediatly. Others even have even worse problems, and don’t fix the NPC problems I already have.[/quote]

Don’t have model ID’s that are the same as the npc’s model ID.

Read full topic

item.title: Fixing broken cache?
item.dc:creator: @dillingo dillingo
item.description:
@dillingo wrote:

[quote=“Tonic, post:7, topic:289778”][quote author=14-08 link=topic=383055.msg2876468#msg2876468 date=1248071143]
Sometimes, like with my own cache, it is broken and is simply fixable with a new cache.

But, like you already said, new caches don’t work with certain client.

So, my only recommendation would be to get a new client. Or, perhaps, look for a another downloadable cache. One is bound to work with your client.

 -- 14-08

[/quote]

If the items get messed up then just re add the models[/quote]
Yeah I’ve been trying that too. It doesn’t work though. Besides, the cache I have now is the best compared to all the other client’s caches. Other clients really don’t work with my server either. Some, (Like Bluur’s) just disconnect you immediatly. Others even have even worse problems, and don’t fix the NPC problems I already have.

Read full topic

item.title: Fixing broken cache?
item.dc:creator: @dillingo dillingo
item.description:
@dillingo wrote:




It’s still the same, but my question was really never answered. Is there ANY way to fix broken cache, without replacing the current one?

Read full topic

item.title: Fixing broken cache?
item.dc:creator: @Setsuna Setsuna
item.description:
@Setsuna wrote:

dillingo:

Iv’e tried that but it doesn’t flow with my server well. A lot of the items and NPC’s are messed up with a new cache.

Get a new client. I suggest Galkon’s.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Setsuna wrote:

dillingo:

Can I do it? I have a cache editor, I’m just not really sure on what to do. Some of my NPC’s are messed up, and I want to fix them. (i.e Chicken is Armydal Godsword special). So any help would be appreciated.

Get a new cache.
